```py
`# Ultralytics YOLO üöÄ, AGPL-3.0 license # COCO8-pose dataset (first 8 images from COCO train2017) by Ultralytics # Documentation: https://docs.ultralytics.com/datasets/pose/coco8-pose/ # Example usage: yolo train data=coco8-pose.yaml # parent # ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ultralytics # ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ datasets #     ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ coco8-pose  ‚Üê downloads here (1 MB)  # Train/val/test sets as 1) dir: path/to/imgs, 2) file: path/to/imgs.txt, or 3) list: [path/to/imgs1, path/to/imgs2, ..] path:  ../datasets/coco8-pose  # dataset root dir train:  images/train  # train images (relative to 'path') 4 images val:  images/val  # val images (relative to 'path') 4 images test:  # test images (optional)  # Keypoints kpt_shape:  [17,  3]  # number of keypoints, number of dims (2 for x,y or 3 for x,y,visible) flip_idx:  [0,  2,  1,  4,  3,  6,  5,  8,  7,  10,  9,  12,  11,  14,  13,  16,  15]  # Classes names:   0:  person  # Download script/URL (optional) download:  https://github.com/ultralytics/assets/releases/download/v0.0.0/coco8-pose.zip` 
```

```py
`from ultralytics import YOLO  # Load a model model = YOLO("yolov8n-pose.pt")  # load a pretrained model (recommended for training)  # Train the model results = model.train(data="coco8-pose.yaml", epochs=100, imgsz=640)` 
```

```py
`# Start training from a pretrained *.pt model yolo  pose  train  data=coco8-pose.yaml  model=yolov8n-pose.pt  epochs=100  imgsz=640` 
```
